textBeforeTable: Our Project Management Professional Test-prep course follows the same PMP examination content outline established by PMI, as detailed below. You’ll need the relevant skills, education and experience to be eligible to take the certification exam. In addition, our project management certificates and Project Management Professional Test-Prep course can help you gain the body of knowledge needed to sit for the exam. Preparing for PMP/CAPM For more information on eligibility, see the PMP Handbook. The CAPM credential is valid for five years. During the fifth year, certified PMs are required to retake and pass the exam again, which covers standard information as well as updates to the PMBOK® Guide. No PDUs are required. Entry-level project managers seeking CAPM certification need a secondary degree, at least 1,000 of PM experience and 23 hours of PM education to sit for the exam. The PMP certification is valid for three years. Recertification requires 60 hours of PDUs. Our noncredit courses can help you satisfy this requirement. Your project management experience must span all phases of the project life cycle — initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing. A secondary degree (high school diploma, associate degree or global equivalent) and at least five years of PM experience, with 7,500 hours leading and directing projects and 35 hours of PM education A four-year degree and at least three years of PM experience, with 4,500 hours leading and directing projects and 35 hours of PM education To sit for the PMP
textAfterTable: Source: Project Management Professional (PMP) Handbook, page 18 If you plan to take the CAPM exam, our Project Management Fundamentals can also help you prepare. The exam is usually only offered at PMI-approved testing centers. In years past, this computer-based exam has consisted of 200 multiple-choice questions to be completed in four hours. To pass, candidates had to score 106 correct answers out of 175. To get more information about applying for and scheduling an exam, visit PMI.org. PMP Test-Prep Retake Policy Our goal is to provide you with all the tools and knowledge you’ll need to succeed. In the unlikely event that you don’t pass the exam, we have a free retake policy that allows you to repeat the Project Management Professional Test-prep course at no additional tuition cost. To qualify, you must have successfully completed this PMP Test-prep course but not passed the associated certification exam. Before being allowed to retake the course, you must provide an official copy of the exam result. You must retake the test-prep course within 365 days of the original start date of the course. Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification The Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certificate Program (Noncredit) presents the knowledge and skills needed to implement the Lean Six Sigma Methodology and the tests necessary to demonstrate that knowledge. Students who successfully complete the program can transition to BMGI, an international Six Sigma consulting firm, to complete the Green Belt certification process. Learn more about BMGI’s
